review_title: Decent company mentality, but company is small and grant-funded so stability is non-existent
pros: Overall, the company does care about its employees and strives for a decent culture.  A lot of the employees are friendly, educated and hard-working, and get along with each other.  The office is nice and fairly up to date, and located in a well-maintained professional building.
cons: Although the company may try to treat its employees in a decent manner, their funding makes it nearly impossible for them to do so.  The company is non-profit and funded through state and federal grants, which are being cut left and right.  Job stability is non-existent.  Opportunities for advancement are extremely limited, and preferential treatment is given to particular "favorite" employees.  Benefits have been slashed each year I have been here, as well as salary freezes.  Significant layoffs have occurred.  These economic times are hitting ABH hard, and although no company is solid as a rock in today's climate, ABH is extremely unstable and volatile right now.
